podcast_summary: In this episode of Mashly at the Movies Movie Trivia, the host, Matt and Ashley, are joined by their friend Ryan as a contestant. They ask Ryan a series of movie-related questions, including identifying film trilogies, last movies directed by Charlie Chaplin, and the last line of Some Like It Hot. Ryan answers most of the questions correctly, demonstrating his knowledge of movies and filmmakers like Chloe Zhao and Stanley Kubrick. Overall, Ryan answers 11 out of 15 questions correctly, impressing the hosts and proving his love for film.

podcast_guest.name: Ryan
podcast_guest.summary:
Arnold Alois Schwarzenegger (born July 30, 1947) is an Austrian and American actor, businessman, filmmaker, politician, and former professional bodybuilder best known for his roles in high-profile action movies. He served as the 38th governor of California from 2003 to 2011 and was among Time magazine's 100 most influential people in the world in 2004 and 2007.Schwarzenegger began lifting weights at age 15 and won the Mr. Universe title aged 20, and subsequently the Mr. Olympia title seven times. He is widely regarded as one of the greatest bodybuilders of all time, and has written many books and articles about it. The Arnold Sports Festival, considered the second-most important bodybuilding event after Mr. Olympia, is named after him. He appeared in the bodybuilding documentary Pumping Iron (1977). He retired from bodybuilding and gained worldwide fame as a Hollywood action star, with his breakthrough in the sword and sorcery epic Conan the Barbarian (1982), a box-office hit with a sequel in 1984. After playing the title character in the science fiction film The Terminator (1984), he starred in Terminator 2: Judgment Day (1991) and three other sequels. His other successful action films included Commando (1985), The Running Man (1987), Predator (1987), Total Recall (1990), and True Lies (1994), in addition to comedy films such as Twins (1988), Kindergarten Cop (1990) and Jingle All the Way (1996). He is the founder of the film production company Oak Productions.As a registered Republican, Schwarzenegger chaired the President's Council on Physical Fitness and Sports during most of the George H. W. Bush administration. On October 7, 2003, he was elected Governor of California in a special recall election to replace then-Governor Gray Davis. He received 48.6% of the vote, 17 points ahead of Democrat runner-up Cruz Bustamante. He was sworn in on November 17 to serve the remainder of Davis' term, and was reelected in the 2006 California gubernatorial election with an increased vote share of 55.9% to serve a full term. In 2011 he reached his term limit as governor and returned to acting.
Schwarzenegger was nicknamed the "Austrian Oak" in his bodybuilding days, "Arnie" or "Schwarzy" during his acting career, and "the Governator" (a portmanteau of "Governor" and "Terminator") during his political career. He married Maria Shriver, a niece of President John F. Kennedy, in 1986. They separated in 2011 after he admitted to having fathered a child with their housemaid in 1997; their divorce was finalized in 2021.

podcast_highlights:
In this podcast episode of Mashley at the Movies Movie Trivia, the hosts, Matt and Ashley, are joined by their friend Ryan as a contestant. They ask Ryan 15 movie-related questions and keep score of his answers. Some of the key points include:

1. Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy co-starred in the Before Trilogy, consisting of Before Sunrise (1995), Before Sunset (2004), and Before Midnight (2013).
2. Ryan incorrectly guesses Charlie Chaplin's last directed and acted movie as Limelight, but it was actually Accountus from Hong Kong (1967).
3. Ryan struggles to remember the last line of Some Like It Hot (1959), which is "Nobody's perfect."
4. Ryan correctly answers the question about the character who runs the bathhouse in Spirited Away, which is Yubaba.
5. Ryan correctly identifies the character played by Denholm Elliott in Raiders of the Lost Ark and Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade as Marcus Brody.
6. Ryan remembers that Marcus Brody got lost in his own museum in the Indiana Jones films.
7. Ryan successfully names three of the four feature films directed by Chloe Zhao. They are The Rider, Nomadland, and Eternals. The fourth film is Song My Brother's Taught Me.
8. Ryan correctly answers that Brokeback Mountain should have won the Best Picture Oscar in 2005, but it lost to Crash.
9. Ryan knows that Maxine is the forthcoming third movie in Ty West's horror trilogy starring Mia Goth.
10. Ryan is unable to recall that Let the Right One In (2008) is set in a suburb of Stockholm, Sweden.
11. Ryan correctly identifies 1982 as the year in which E.T. the Extraterrestrial, The Thing, Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan, Blade Runner, and Tron were all released.
12. Ryan successfully names two of the five films in which Humphrey Bogart and Peter Lorre starred together: Casablanca and The Maltese Falcon.
13. Ryan knows that Bo Burnham had a role in The Big Sick (2017) starring Kumail Nanjiani and Zoe Kazan.
14. Ryan confidently answers that Jack Lemmon starred as C.C. Baxter in The Apartment.
15. Ryan correctly lists the four Stanley Kubrick films released in the 1960s: 2001: A Space Odyssey, Lolita, Spartacus, and Dr. Strangelove or How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb.

Overall, Ryan answers 11 of the 15 questions correctly, making him a talented participant in the movie trivia game.
